title: exosome_adult human_rep1
source_name_ch1: human suspended red blood cell unit with leukocyte reduced
treatment_protocol_ch1: Supernatant from suspended red blood cell unit with leukocyte reduced were seperated by centrifugation.Exosome were extracted by ExoQuick reagent bought from SBI company and stored at -80℃.
growth_protocol_ch1: All human blood donors were free.Whole blood were collected in the donation room.Whole blood were made into suspended red blood cell unit with leukocyte reduced within 6 hours.Suspended red blood cell unit stored at 2-6℃ for 2 weeks.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using TRIzol (Invitrogen) and miRNeasy mini kit (QIAGEN) according to manufacturer鈥檚 instructions, which efficiently recovered all RNA species, including miRNAs. RNA quality and quantity was measured by using nanodrop spectrophotometer (ND-1000, Nanodrop Technologies) and RNA Integrity was determined by gel electrophoresis
label_protocol_ch1: The miRCURY™ Hy3™/Hy5™ Power labeling kit (Exiqon, Vedbaek, Denmark) was used according to the manufacturer’s guideline for miRNA labelling
hyb_protocol: The Hy3TM-labeled samples were hybridized on the miRCURYTM LNA Array (v.16.0) (Exiqon) according to array manual
scan_protocol: The slides were scanned using the Axon GenePix 4000B microarray scanner (Axon Instruments, Foster City, CA).
description: Human blood donor were male and free
data_processing: Scanned images were then imported into GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon) for grid alignment and data extraction. Replicated miRNAs were averaged and miRNAs that intensities>=50 in all samples were chosen for calculating normalization factor. Expressed data were normalized using the Median normalization. After normalization, differentially expressed miRNAs with statistical significance were identified through Volcano Plot filtering
